meanings.definition: The quality or state of being incessant.
meanings.sent1: The incessancy of the rain made it difficult to go outside.
meanings.sent2: The incessancy of the baby's crying kept the parents awake all night.
meanings.sent3: The incessancy of the clock ticking became a background rhythm to their conversation.
meanings.sent4: The incessancy of the waves crashing against the shore was both calming and relentless.
meanings.sent5: The incessancy of the dripping faucet echoed through the empty house.

meanings.definition: The continuous or unceasing nature of something.
meanings.sent1: The incessancy of the wind made the trees sway constantly.
meanings.sent2: The incessancy of the traffic outside the window was a constant hum in the background.
meanings.sent3: The incessancy of the dog's barking startled the birds in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The incessancy of the clock ticking seemed to mock his inability to focus.
meanings.sent5: The incessancy of the notifications on his phone was overwhelming.
